website_summaries.verdict: A great choice for frequent campers who need a durable sleeping bag that can stand up to a lot of use.
pros: Mummy-style bag with a hood helps keep your head warm
Keeps you warm down to 40 degrees, but suitable for use in temperatures as low as to 0 degrees
Made of heavy-duty material that won't tear
Fits adults up to 7 feet tall
cons: This bag may cost a little more than some are willing to spend

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap bag
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent sleeping bag. Really snug fit for larger sized males. (6'2", 230). Not truly long enough and not wide enough at the shoulders. If you don't mind not zipping all the way up then it's ok. I would only recommend for customers who are 6'0" or shorter with a narrower shoulder width. Other than that it's built great, stays warm (keep in mind 0 degrees is the extreme rating). I will buy another that fits me a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but too bulky
customer_reviews.text: I like this bag for its price and comfort, and definitely would choose to own. I returned this bag because it does not compact small enough to take on my backpacking trip. The compression sack it comes with compresses it down not too much at all, and still the compressed sleeping bag takes up 40% of my 60L backpack, which is not at all useful for a backpacking trip. Great bag, great price, if you do not mind the bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene L. Grunenwald

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for the price, even like the development of the company from two outdoor enthusiast. I have spent way more on NF, Kelty, and MH bags and camping gear. I like to see that they have included many of the top features. It is a very comfortable bag with good technical feaures.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Moody

customer_reviews.title: 5/5 perfect
customer_reviews.text: Used in Yosemite just days after buying. Nights were around 20 degrees, but I was very warm and slept through the night. Would recommend to anyone, don't waste your money on crazy expensive bags.
customer_reviews.author: clara

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Used this sleeping bag all winter and it was fantastic. Comfortable, soft, warm and snug. People claim that they are still cold in this sleeping bag but 1. they're probably sleeping directly on the cold ground which (common sense) you don't do and 2. aren't wearing appropriate winter bedtime clothing.
customer_reviews.author: R-

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for high altitude mountaineering.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband's mountain trek in high altitudes in the Kashmir region of the Himalayas. This was perfect as it was fairly lightweight and provided the warmth as temperature recede overnight.
customer_reviews.author: anniesg

customer_reviews.title: Bittersweet
customer_reviews.text: So I LOVE this bag, from the color to the material to the warmth. Compressed great. I used this bag in the porcupine mountains up in Michigan while hammock camping and it performed great in cold weather. But the zipper got stuck while I was getting out of it on the 3rd day I used it and the stitching came apart. Now I have a bag that I can't use, very disappointing I was looking forward to many miles with this bag
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Couzy
customer_reviews.text: A little bulky packed up, but very warm (camped in about 38-45 degrees Fahrenheit) and a perfectly snug fit for me, not too tight. I wouldn't suggest this bag to larger individuals, as it is not an XL bag other than in length. I'm over 6 ft tall and had plenty of extra foot space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and very comfortable sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value and very comfortable sleeping bag. It made it's way to the Ventana Wilderness and to the Santa Cruz Island in the Channel Island NP chain without a hitch, zippers are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: caregiver

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The bag is large, well made, excellent zipper and very cushy. Will even keep it handy in case we loose power at home during our ice storms. Very reasonable price and glad that it is made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: C. Tubb

customer_reviews.title: Not for cold weather
customer_reviews.text: Froze until I left the tent and slept in the car. Although it was extra long I couldn't zip it without assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Girl 76

customer_reviews.title: Really warm but bulky
customer_reviews.text: This bag was warm, but I can't recommend it if you're looking to use it for backpacking or are looking for a really compact sleeping bag. I used this at elevation and the temperature was about 45 degrees, I wouldn't go much colder with that, maybe 35-40, but I also sleep pretty warm anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon14

customer_reviews.title: Warm, Affordable bag!
customer_reviews.text: My son is 12 and a Scout, this bag kept him warm on his Winter Survival. So we I rdered two mire, one for me and one for my 11 year old Scout. Great, affordable product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: so far only used it once. It was also the first time i spent the night in a hammock where the weather dropped down to 35 degrees Fahrenheit. I stayed relatively warm minus the pressure points. This is probably the hammocks fault and not the sleeping bags. I am 6'0 200 and i fit snug in the upper body areas and had plenty of room down at my feet. probably an extra 2-3 inches down there. It was extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Rob M.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I got this bag for my daughter. She had a Cats Meow that was too worn out to keep her warm. She lives this new bag but complains that it is much larger than her old bag. She says she doesn’t care however because this bag was so comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Darrel

customer_reviews.title: love this bag but zipper ripped first night camping
customer_reviews.text: love this bag but zipper ripped first night camping. i dont really mind as i use it more as a blanket with somewhere to put my feet into. had no issues in 20-30 weather. will see how it does this fall. Live in Colorado.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Van Wirt

customer_reviews.title: Love the bag
customer_reviews.text: Shipment arrived exactly as described. Love the bag. This is the way e-business should be conducted. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Smith

customer_reviews.title: A++
customer_reviews.text: Was perfect for my sons canoe trip to the boundary waters. highly recommend for the price too!
customer_reviews.author: WI Mom

customer_reviews.title: Hey tall campers.........
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son who is 6'3" and he says his feet stay warm and he fits inside comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Nice sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: We bought these before we went camping near Yellowstone. The temp got into the low 40's, actually had frost in the morning. I was plenty warm just sleeping in my boxers.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I thought the bag had great quality. Just too small for my frame. Returned with no issues. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: b_rent

customer_reviews.title: warm & easy to pack
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, warm & easy to pack. A great buy!
customer_reviews.author: shawna

customer_reviews.title: NICE BAG
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag. Have used it in 20 degree weather and it kept me warm I have no complaints what so ever about this product..
customer_reviews.author: Robert Temple

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked good at 35° + below that I was on the cold side. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Kane

customer_reviews.title: nice bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like this bag nothing fancy kept me super warm at 20 degree temps too warm. The only thing is I felt it a little small I had a hard time rolling over and it just kept twisting and turning. I guess I just dont really like the mummy bag style.
customer_reviews.author: Elenor Rigby

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good bag - used once so far on a rainy campout. Compact and stayed warm.
customer_reviews.author: Tonia Boger

customer_reviews.title: Warm enough for cold nights
customer_reviews.text: Warm enough for cold nights! It was compact, warm enough & light enough to use backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer John

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have not tried this sleeping bag yet at 0 F gradus. It looks lower part closely.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had some cold nights and the bag worked great. Delivered promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Derick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: For the price of it I would definitely buy another one. It is very warm and packs up light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke
customer_reviews.text: It kept me warm but now the zipper is broken and I had it less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Martina Dale

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal bag at a phenomenal price.
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal bag at a phenomenal price. Used it in West Virginia in the middle of winter and I did not get cold once
customer_reviews.author: heath manalli

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I used this outside at night without a tent and it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable bag. We use these when camping on the motorcycle so space saving is a must but we are not willing to give up warmth. We have used these in a tent. My spouse and I both comfortable (I'm always cold, he is always warm) during all of our trips. Coldest night sleeping around 30 degrees and warmest around 55 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: We bought a total of 10 sleeping bags for our grandchildren for a Christmas present. They were thrilled (to say nothing of how their parents reacted!). We have one grandson use it on an "up north" experience (Minnesota) at an outdoor environmental week long experience. Of course, he slept indoors, but he was pretty thrilled with it nevertheless. We looked long term at scout camp outs and young women camp outs and also family camping. Pretty much everyone was thrilled. And the customer service with the company was exceptional! Great value, great price, great produce!
customer_reviews.author: S. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, Bad stuff sack, Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag, for the price. After about a year the stitching on the stuff sack has come undone and the sack tore in another place. I had difficulty finding a way to contact the manufacturer directly to ask them about a replacement stuff sac given the lifetime warranty. Finally, I contacted the amazon seller (Gear Meister) and they were VERY helpful with sending a replacement. Within a day, they sent a new one out to me. Top notch customer service.
customer_reviews.author: thegoodson

customer_reviews.title: Good Bag!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, like it a lot, but its pretty long. I'm 6' tall and have loads of room at my feet, so while this bag is great for me, smaller people might find it a bit much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you are under six feet tall and have a small frame then you might like this sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: TO SMALL not for big people. I am six feet four inches and weight a little over 200 pounds. The bag was to small. I have tried to sleep in this bag at cold temps last winter, but I couldn't get it zipped up past my chest area with my arms inside. If you are under six feet tall and have a small frame then you might like this sleeping bag. This sleeping bad is very well made and very warm and if they made one in my size I might buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Jones

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: The best sleeping bag! I bought this to use after a fundraising walk. I walked 26 miles and slept in a tent! Last year was 30 degrees I just wish I had it last year! This year when everyone was getting up early to leave their tents because they couldn't take it anymore, I stayed right in my sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.author: T.L.

customer_reviews.title: The tight fit may be good for warmth but if you're one inch taller or ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the biggest one and can't hardly zip it up. The tight fit may be good for warmth but if you're one inch taller or wider than me forget it! I should've sent it back but it'll work in a pinch so I kept it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: more for a thinner person
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sleeping bag for a thinner person. I am 6' 2" and it doesn't fit my shoulders. I'm keeping it because of the quality.
customer_reviews.author: stiletto56

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable bag!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for a weekend camping trip, so nothing too intense. I was very, very impressed with the quality of this bag. The temperature went under 40 degrees, and I was still toasty warm. It's also very soft and cushiony, and the drawstring around the opening closes the bag pretty well to conserve heat. Probably not a great backpacking bag, as I couldn't fit it back into the case when I packed up, but this is definitely a great bag for general camping purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Gosling

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: impressed with carrying case can not wait to use camping with grand kids
customer_reviews.author: Papa Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Well I returned it before I could test it out, but that was because I need a backpacking sleeping bag, and this is not that. Too big, compressed, especially for the warmth rating. I tried the other Rovor prior to this one, and it fit good, and was very compressible, but i could see through it and felt that it would not provide any where near the warmth that one would require at night. Most of the reviews reflect the same for both of them.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Maybe in the past this was a good bag but it is not anymore so I returned ...
customer_reviews.text: Bag is not well made. Fill is not sewn to anything to prevent it from shifting and lumping. Stitching on cover is strictly for looks. Reviews said it was made in the US but bag said China. Maybe in the past this was a good bag but it is not anymore so I returned it.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable. Keep me nice and warm all night 5 stars for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: I froze and it was 34 degrees out. My wife had a 20 dollar coleman bag and was fine. Definitely not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: benjamin mccann

customer_reviews.title: First off- i'm pretty sure the photo of the person holding the sleeping ...
customer_reviews.text: First off- i'm pretty sure the photo of the person holding the sleeping bag is photoshopped..oh wait i'm positive, the arm is distorted as it gets to the hand. That being said this is NOT a sleeping bag for long voyages..more like a sleeping bag for a kids sleepover or the occasional camper. It is bulky and fat. Note: they do not make any claims that this is good for long "voyages" but non the less i felt i should warn my people.

product_meta.title: ROVOR Couzy 40 Degree Mummy Sleeping Bag
product_meta.description:
Indulge in the ultimate comfort and warmth with the Rovor Couzy 40 Degree Mummy Sleeping Bag

Lifetime Warranty

*Like all Rovor Products, the Couzy Cold Weather Sleeping Bag has a lifetime warranty against manufacturer
defects, and every product is tested to the highest quality standards. If there are any issues that arise, just
send it to Rovor or any Rovor retailer for a hassle free replacement.

Fits Tall Adults & Teens

*This is a perfect sleeping bag for adults and tall teens, but can also be used as a kids sleeping bag. It is
among the tallest on the market at 90 inches in length and has a recommended maximum height of 7 feet.

Heavy Duty & Built to Last

*Our Camping Sleeping Bag is outfitted with YKK zippers for no-snag performance from the world’s leading
zipper brand, and a premium reinforced mini-diamond ripstop polyester shell that is lightweight without
sacrificing durability.

Measurements & Weight:

The Couzy Adult Sleeping Bag measures 90 inches long, 32 inches wide at the shoulders, and 21 inches
wide at the foot. When packed in the included stuff sack the Couzy measures 17 inches long with a 10-inch
diameter (uncompressed) and weighs 4.7 pounds.

Temperature Rating:

Comfort: 40°F. A typical person will have a comfortable nights rest at temperatures at or above 40°F.

Extreme: 0°F. The minimum temperature this bag may be used for up to 6 hours to avoid exposure is 0°F.

Both ratings are done assuming you are wearing thermal underwear, a warm hat, and using a 1-inch
sleeping pad. You will sleep comfortably at or above the comfort rating. We don't recommend using the bag
in temps below that. You can use the sleeping bag to prevent exposure for up to six hours at the extreme
rating. The bag should never be used in temperatures below the extreme rating.
